subject: Cybersecurity
title: Block Ciphers vs. Stream Ciphers
description: A fast breakdown of Block Ciphers vs. Stream Ciphers for builders.

hook.text: Some ciphers eat data in chunks. Others swallow it one byte at a time. Each has a purpose.

buildup.text: Block ciphers (like AES) encrypt fixed-size blocks. Stream ciphers (like ChaCha20) encrypt data as it flows.

discovery.text: Block ciphers are great for files. Stream ciphers excel at real-time communication like video calls.

twist.text: A block cipher can become a stream cipher using the right mode of operation. The line is blurrier than it seems.

climax.text: Choosing the wrong cipher type for a task can break security even if the algorithm is perfectly strong.

punchline.text: The right cipher depends on what you're encrypting.

quiz.question: When are stream ciphers preferred over block ciphers?
options: For real-time communication like video calls
